definitions.definition: To utter words indistinctly or unintelligibly; to utter inarticulate sounds
examples: The men were babbling , so we couldn't make sense of anything.

definitions.definition: To talk incoherently ; to utter meaningless words.
To talk too much; to chatter ; to prattle .
To make a continuous murmuring noise, like shallow water running over stones.
examples: Hounds are said to babble, or to be babbling, when they are too noisy after having found a good scent.

definitions.definition: To utter in an indistinct or incoherent way; to repeat words or sounds in a childish way without understanding.
To reveal ; to give away (a secret).

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To utter words indistinctly or unintelligibly; to utter inarticulate sounds
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To talk incoherently ; to utter meaningless words.
( intransitive ) To talk too much; to chatter ; to prattle .
( intransitive ) To make a continuous murmuring noise, like shallow water running over stones.
( transitive ) To utter in an indistinct or incoherent way; to repeat words or sounds in a childish way without understanding.
( transitive ) To reveal ; to give away (a secret).
